page.title: 17BURRINGTON VILLAGE SHOPS
page.content: {THE SHOP}was formerly, until 1885, {a coaching inn,}the London Inn, on the road from Barnstaple to Exeter before the A377 was built. The shop is owned by Mr.and Mrs. Miller, and part-time helpers are Miss Miller & Mrs.Kingdom. The{busiest day}is Thursday,pension day, and the{busiest time}is 3.30 to 4.30p.m.because of the schoolchildren. They also deliver to houses away from the village. {THE POST OFFICE}is{a listed building.} It is run by Mrs.Watkins. When they go on holiday their friend comes and helps.They open from 9.00 until 5.30. On Saturday they are open in the morning.Their{busy days}are Tuesday, Thursday and Friday.They obtain stamps from the Headpostmaster at Barnstaple. The letters come from{Umberleigh.}
